text:
She hid behind the cupboard, trembling. 

He found her, took her in his arms. 

“Don’t be afraid,” he whispered. 

He sat her on the bed, undressed her. 

Her shoes dripped with rainwater. 

He covered her with a blanket. 

She fell asleep instantly. 

He sighed, annoyance creeping in. 

“Why do I care?” he thought. 

He opened the door to leave. 

“Damn the child!” he muttered. 

He glanced back. 

She slept soundly, cheeks flushed. 

“Fever,” he noted, surprised. 

Her lips glowed, a sly smile formed. 

Was she pretending? 

Her eyes seemed to wink.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Svidrigaïlov finds a child hiding in his room, takes care of her, and reflects on her unsettling appearance and demeanor.
